comment: I had her for Printmaking I and the class was very work-intensive. I spent a lot of my free time at the studio. Also she tends to be very passive aggressive and generally unpleasant.

I took Professor Reynoso for her Printmaking 1 class. She is a good professor who will do her best at helping even the most inexperienced of students. That being said, she is a very heavy grader, and she is very strict on attendance and participation. You will be expected to work outside of class, and there are a lot of assignments.

There's so much work. AN ABSOLUTELY INSANE AMOUNT OF WORK! She is by far the most caring teacher I ever met, though. I am disabled, and she spent hours of one-on-one time with me trying to help me get everything done.

She's is a good teacher but she can be a little strange with grading. I'm someone who doesn't have too much drawing experience and it sometimes felt like we were expected to just naturally get better and it would show with my grades when I wasn't fully understanding a concept. Overall though, she tries her best to connect with her student.
She would grade my art as if it were to be drawn through her own interpretation. I found that quite offensive since it's my art and art is subjective.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I loved having Prof. Reynoso. One of the best art classes I ever taken. She give great feedback. I would definitely take her again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She gives great feedback during regular class and critiques. Started off giving some lectures in the beginning of the semester then just let us read about the techniques on our own so we had more time to work during class. There is always something to do every week so you really need to stay on top of things. She is pretty lenient on things though.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Professor Reynoso was attentive and willing to listen to you when discussing projects. She sets clear rubrics and gives constructive feedback. I enjoyed her class and would definitely take her again! Ultimately take every review with a grain of salt and decide for yourself whether you like her teaching style or not.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: She's really good about giving feedback and helping you figure out what to improve on however, I've found her to be super passive aggressive if I need to leave early or have one too many questions. She's not mean, she can just get passive aggressive quickly and docks points for the tiniest things. Not the worst but certainly not the best :/
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: Professor Reynoso is seriously underrated. She's very patient and she really tries to help you when you're struggling with something. Attending class will help boost your grade, as work from class will help for midterms/finals. She is a bit of a tough grader, but she's very clear on what she expects from your work. It's not an easy A, but take her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: this class was ridiculous. going into a drawing one class you'd expect to learn how to use materials however most of the time we were just told ok draw this in x material with no prior knowledge. art is subjective and everyone has their own style but if you dont draw something the way she likes it you wont get a good grade.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: This class was one of the most unnecessarily work-heavy classes I have ever taken. It doesn't matter how much effort or time you put into a project she will take off points for the smallest things that you will not be able to avoid to begin with. If possible avoid taking her.

I have her at the Art institute of Atlanta for design fundamentals. She's awful. The class is almost five hours long and most of it is spent with boring lectures. She gives a ton of work and isn't always clear about what needs to be turned in when. If you're late to class (even by ten minutes) you get points taken off of your grade. DON'T TAKE HER.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Reynoso is genuinely sweet and funny in class, but she also really cares about the material shes teaching, so you cant expect an easy A. Shes a bit of a tough grader, but she gives a lot of feedback during critique and on written assignments, so you know what she expects out of your work. Overall an interesting and fun class.

Gina is awesome!!! She tells you exactly what you need to do and is extremely helpful with learning and tweaking your print making process. I only have positive things to say! Wish i would have taken her class when i had more time to do all the work thoroughly though because it was really fun.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: very boring lecture, you will probably fall asleep. she is a very nice lady though, and makes the class easy to pass. 3 tests , extra credit, and other assignments. the tests are fairly easy, as long as you review the powerpoints. she is very confusing when it comes to wording everything. other assignments in class are very easy.

Professor Reynoso is incredibly patient and just a very pleasant person in general. She is a bit of a tough grader; I received a lot of low As and high Bs. Good or perfect attendance, however, is the best way to maximize your grade if you struggle with the work. She is very helpful and understanding if students are having trouble as well.
There was plenty of work but she was helpful throughout the process. She's funny and friendly. I took her for printmaking not art appreciation.

Gina was a phenomenal professor. During her printmaking 2 class through her teaching I was able to fully understand the techniques and methods of printmaking will recieving a good grade. Although you have to work hard in learning these methods she is and overall good teacher that will help you in any way she can.

Gina Reynoso May come across as quiet or standoffish, however, upon getting to know her you will find that she is an incredibly knowledgeable and helpful professor. Her instructions are clear but you do have to work hard. The class was extremely enjoyable and Prof. Reynoso has a great sense of humor and kindness.

idk if I'd say the tests are hard; they're kinda weird. An art piece reviewed in the lecture is shown up on the projector and then some questions about it. Know the art terms. Its hard to study for. There's a group project worth a bit of your grade. If you took AP classes with weird teachers in hs, you'll do fine. Anyone else, it'll b an adjustment

Professor Reynoso is a very nice lady overall, but her class is unbelievably difficult. There are 3 tests, a project and other side assignments. As a straight A student, I have gotten D's on 2 out of the 3 tests that we've taken so far even with extensive studying. She makes this class unnecessarily hard, and her lectures are boring. Stay away.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She's quite sassy and she sounds like shes reading from a history text book for an hour and fifteen minutes, sprinkled with her own opinions that she then tests you on. And the tests are basically 40 questions of judging pictures of art. She makes the information so uninteresting, and that's coming from someone who really likes art and history.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She is incredibly rude and unhelpful. The class is very difficult and there is a ton of material she expects you to know for her tests and like others have said, it seems like she sets you up for failure. Avoid her if you can.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: This teacher is horrible. Never take her class. She is rude and does not care what your excuse was. She canceled class because her "back hurt" which is pointless because she doesn't even walk in class. She stands by her podium and reads slides from her computer. I would never ever take her class again.
She's too tough. Art is suppose to be an easy A, but it's not with her. It's like she's setting you up for failure. Don't take her.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: She is horrible. Her lectures are boring, it made me wanna cry a little bit. She has 4 tests and a museum report. Her tests suck and they´re very opinion based so you have to think like she´s thinking. I only took this class because I thought it was going to be easy, but it´s my lowest grade.
